result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmy D Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served. REPORT DATED 02-02-2017 by 05:00 pm. STRAIGHT TIME. 
*THE COURT WAIVED all other costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent. The bail shall be returned to the remitter.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and the Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 20 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served. REPORT DATED 02-02-2017 by 05:00 pm

THE COURT WAIVED all other costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent. The bail shall be returned to the remitter.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Sentencing Referral Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received discovery and offer.  Plea Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to a conflict of interest in the Public Defender's office Defense requesting to withdraw as counsel. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status of Counsel scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of motion and motion To Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant received and filed with the court.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Defendant is to be turned over to Justice point again. Defendant is to comply with all previously ordered conditions. Defendant is advised all previously ordered conditions of bail remain the same. Any noncompliance is to be reported to the Judge right away. Defendant is admonished and informed any noncompliance could result in a significant increase of cash bail.

Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court with attorney Zoe Everett. Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
For reasons placed on the record, defense requests case be calendared for status. State has no objection. Case calendared for status on 08/23/2016 at 01:30 pm, branch 45.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to the Honorable Jean Kies, Branch 45 in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Parties request to address Justice Point discharge report. Case proceeded to bail/bond hearing.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge summary received and filed. LNR

Court is reviewing report.
Justice Point Program violation report: Missed Office Contact; received and filed. Court reviewed violation and takes no action at this time. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court reinstated cash bail that was forfeited on 06-15-2016.  All other bail conditions remains the same.

Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM

All other bail conditions remains the same.  Defense received some discovery and request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Jimmy D Bates in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
